title: Supreme Court on Places of Worship Act Challenges: 'No Further Suits,' Asks Union Govt to File Reply
selftext: The Supreme Court today, December 12, ordered the Union government to file its counter-affidavit within four weeks as it hears the batch of petitions challenging provisions of the Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act of 1991. It also said that no further suits – ostensibly asking for surveys of religious structures – can be registered till it hears and disposes of these pleas.
comments:
No further suits.

  
So, they are happy with what's already registered. These ashats know how to toe the line of not being called out.

  
We are doomed.
